page.title: 13STEPNEY REMEMBERED : HULL
page.content: Born in 1886 - the year Stepney Primary School was built, the old man recalled his schooldays. He told us how all the teachers carried sticks or straps which they used a lot. There were games periods but not at playing fields (we sometimes go to Pearson Park) but in the school yard. His favourite was rounders. For holidays they had only two weeks in Summer, plus Bank Holidays. There were no school meals and at lunchtime he went to a cafe at Cave Street where he bought soup for one penny. He came from a poor family and so left school at thirteen (most left at fourteen) to work on the horse-drawn trams, which were changed just outside the school.
